intro: Helleborus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to central and southern Europe. It features dark green, narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces clusters of dark purple to black, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. It thrives in shady, moist environments and is often found in woodlands and rocky soils. Helleborus angustifolius is noted for its toxic properties, containing various alkaloids that can be harmful if ingested.
